div.p: Greetings. Since I wrote to you more extensively the day before yesterday, I have nothing to add to that now, except that I am returning your writings to you and I give great thanks for them.

I have received nothing yet, neither from Geneva nor elsewhere. Here are some captains from Valais with the abbot of Saint Maurice, with whom I have spoken; but they themselves have nothing of particular note. Therefore, I do not wish to trouble you with more words now.
Mr. Steiger sends you his careful greetings and thanks Mr. Gwalther for the booklet sent to him.
To the most distinguished man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, my honorable lord and dearest compatriot.
